sentences: Harvard-MIT Division of Health Sciences and Technology
[LIST_ITEM] ECG changes similar to ischemia but due to positional changes
[LIST_ITEM] Heart rate rises from 70 to 85 beats per minute
[LIST_ITEM] Stroke volume rises from 63 to 70 ml
[LIST_ITEM] A-V oxygen difference drops near end of first trimester from 44 to 33 ml/l but then rises again
[LIST_ITEM] Venous pressure unchanged in the arms and raised in the legs

[LIST_ITEM] Mother notes subjective dyspnea as pregnancy advances
[LIST_ITEM] Basal and total insulin goes up
[LIST_ITEM] Daily glucose excretion goes up due to elevated GFR and fixed rate of reabsorption
[LIST_ITEM] Oral 100 gram glucose tolerance test or 50 gram 1 hour glucose challenge test
[LIST_ITEM] Hemoglobin A1c is good measure of long term control
[LIST_ITEM] A1c related to incidence of congenital malformations
IN SUMMARY HST 071 MATERNAL PHYSIOLOGIC CHANGES IN PREGNANCY
[LIST_ITEM] Lower hematocrit (although elevated red cell mass)
